text: (upbeat music)

- [Presenter] The new
Bundesliga Match Fact Skill

focuses on the individual
class of Bundesliga players.

Skills shows off the
stars' outstanding quality,
and is divided into four components.
A sprinter naturally stands out
because of his high maximum speed.
That's why he soars out with deep passes

just like Leverkusen's
Jeremie Frimpong here.

With a top speed of
36.07 kilometers an hour,

he's one of the fastest
players in the league,
but the sprinter doesn't just have
a very high maximum speed.

He's also able to unleash
it on a regular basis.
Take Gerrit Holtmann for example.

No Bochum player makes as many
sprints per game as he does.

- [Announcer] He's got
Gerrit Holtmann up with him.
Holtmann's got the speed to get through.

And he's put it through Schleiber's
legs to make it one-nil.

- [Presenter] The hallmark
of the finisher is not simply
goals in abundance.

He also impresses with a high
degree of finishing efficiency
like Augsburgs's Michael Gregoritsch.

If he gets the ball in the
danger zone, watch out.
- [Announcer] Gregoritsch.
- [Presenter] Or Nil's Petersen.
When he comes off the bench,

the Match Fact Skill
emphasizes his role as a sub
who carries a real goal threat.
And the crowd knows what's coming.
- [Announcer] There's Petersen!
- [Presenter] An important skill

when a team's not in
possession, the ball winner.
He has the ability to recover the ball.
He intercepts the opposition's passes,

and stands out with
strong tackling skills.

Leipzig's Josko Gvardiol
is exemplary at this.

A ball winner not only
stops opponents attacks,

but also enables his team
to start a counter attack.
(upbeat music)
The prime example of an initiator
is Bayerns' Thomas Mueller.
The leagues assist king,

he always knows where
to find his teammates.

- [Announcer] It's another
assist for Thomas Mueller.

- [Presenter] It's all
about launching attacks.

It's also a specialty of
Leverkusen's star, Florian Wirtz.

- [Announcer] Here is
Wirtz, juggles it away.
And he's got open ground to run into now.
Florian Wirtz, he's got Shick waiting.
- [Presenter] But for an initiator,

the decisive factor is not
just the number of assists,
but also the so-called second assist.
That's the penultimate pass
which ultimately leads to a goal.
As we see with Jude Bellingham here,

the initiator is capable
of completing risky passes,
is creative, and manages to conjure up
a goal threat in mere seconds.

Sprinter, finisher,
ball winner, initiator.
The four skill components.

The new Bundesliga Match
Fact powered by AWS

is tailor made for identifying
the most important players
in different areas of the game.
A player can always be highlighted

if he's in the top 10 of
the respected category.
